servinfo.title: DTC P0380: Glow Plug / Heater Circuit “A” Malfunction

item.ptxt: Conditions for applying fault finding procedures to stored faults:
The fault is declared present after output test “Pre/Post Heater Relay Control” on SUZUKI scan tool, or after an attempted engine start.
If the fault is present, it is difficult or even impossible to start the vehicle when cold.
If the fault is present, the Injection warning light (gravity 1 warning light) is lit.
Use service wire for all operations on the ECM connectors.

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: For wiring circuit and connector number, refer to A-5 Engine and A/C Control System Circuit Diagram (DSL) .

entry.ptxt: Open circuit or short circuit to vehicle body ground

servinfosub.title: Troubleshooting for CC.1: Short circuit to +12 V

entry.ptxt: Check the glow plug control module connections and the glow plug supply cables.
Check the condition of the 80A fuse on the battery fuse box.
Check for continuity and insulation against the +12 V feed on the following connections:

item.ptxt: Between “C74-3” wire of glow plug control module connector and “C85-1” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C74-1” wire of glow plug control module connector and “C85-17” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: If the fault is still present, replace the glow plug control module.

servinfosub.title: Troubleshooting for CC.0: Open circuit or short circuit to vehicle body ground and CO: Open circuit

item.ptxt: If the glow plug control module has a short circuit to vehicle body ground there is a risk that the glow plugs will be operated continuously.
The glow plugs and the engine may be damaged.

entry.ptxt: Check the glow plug control module connections and the glow plug supply cables.
Check the condition of the 80A fuse on the battery fuse box.
Check the continuity and insulation against vehicle body ground of the following connection:

item.ptxt: Between “C74-3” wire of glow plug control module connector and “C85-1” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C74-1” wire of glow plug control module connector and “C85-17” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: If the fault is still present, replace the glow plug control module.
Check the glow plug control module connections and the glow plug supply cables.
Check the condition of the 80A fuse on the battery fuse box.
Check the continuity and insulation against vehicle body ground of the following connection:

item.ptxt: Between “C74-3” wire of glow plug control module connector and “C85-1” terminal of ECM connector
Between “C74-1” wire of glow plug control module connector and “C85-17” terminal of ECM connector

entry.ptxt: If the fault is still present, replace the glow plug control module.
